Post:
"I'm still reeling from the sudden loss of my dad's girlfriend. It's like the world has come crashing down around me and I can't seem to find my footing. I keep thinking it's all just a bad dream, but the pain is all too real. 

I can't help but wonder if this is all my fault. Maybe if I had been a better daughter, she would still be here with us. The guilt and regret are suffocating me, and I don't know how to move forward. It feels like a part of me has been torn away, leaving a gaping hole that I don't know how to fill. 

I'm trying to hold on to the memories, but they're slipping away from me too. All I can think about is what could have been, what should have been. It's like my mind is trapped in a never-ending cycle of grief and self-blame. When will the pain subside? When will I be able to breathe again without feeling like I'm drowning in sorrow?"
Transferred_Post:
"I'm still reeling from the sudden loss of my dad's girlfriend. It's like the world has come crashing down around me, and I can't seem to find my footing. I keep thinking it's all just a bad dream, but the pain is all too real. 

I can't help but wonder if this is all temporary. Maybe the pain will subside with time, and I'll be able to move forward. The guilt and regret are suffocating me, but I know that with time, they'll lessen. It feels like a part of me has been torn away, leaving a gaping hole that I don't know how to fill. 

I'm trying to hold on to the memories, but they're slipping away from me too. All I can think about is what could have been, what should have been. It's like my mind is trapped in a never-ending cycle of grief and self-blame, but eventually, that cycle will break. When will the pain subside? When will I be able to breathe again without feeling like I'm drowning in sorrow? Maybe someday soon."
